intro: Nivenia binata, commonly known as the two-flowered nivenia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive two-flowered inflorescence. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, pea-like flowers are usually pale green to yellow, and it produces pods that contain seeds. Nivenia binata is often found in grassland and shrubland habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of its native region.
